      • plan

        public void plan()
        The main method for planing, the initial solution for only strict task is computed, whether the minimal subset of task is feasible. If is then the solution for all the task is being searched. If the solutions is still not found, then comes to the word dividing and shrinking of the tasks in the fist tries and then removing voluntary tasks.

      • bratleyAlg

        public TimeTable bratleyAlg(TimeTable timeTable,
                   int start,
                   double upperBound)
        Since the task is strictly NP-hard to obtain the solution we have to enumerate all the possibilities. To improve the search space (i.e. shirnk it) the Braley's algorithm with bounds is implemented.
        Parameters:
        timeTable -
        start -
        upperBound -
        Returns:
        TimeTable

      • chengDPApproach

        public java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> chengDPApproach(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasksToSeq)
        Algorithm based on dynamic programing implemented according to http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0898-1221(90)90001-Z. Output of this algorithm is an optimal sequence for selected tasks. Although the algorithm is DP, it scaled with the combinatorial numbers of selected tasks - which allow quick computation only to number of tasks around 20. The output sequence is optimal according to the DP principal of optimality. The algorithm was slightly modified - in the computation of current reward the deadline is subtracted - my task have not only release dates but also deadlines.

      • computeCostFunction

                         java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<TimeTableScheduler.SubsetId,java.lang.Double>> fTable,
                         TimeTableScheduler.SubsetId vyber)
        Computation of the cost function for the Cheng DP algorithm
        Parameters:
        stage - - desired stage of planning
        fTable - - table with stored values
        vyber - - subset of task that we are examining
        Returns:
